title.native: フリップフラッパーズ

description:
As a middle school student, Cocona has been trying to decide what to do with her life. Magical Girl, however, wasn’t a career path that she’d ever considered. When suddenly a strange girl named Papika thrusts her into a secret organization called Flip Flap, Cocona’s outlook does a radical flip-flop. Her views start to change when she is dragged into an alternate dimension called Pure Illusion where she’s charged with gathering crystal shards and fighting strange creatures. Now, between running missions and facing off against a rival organization, Cocona doesn’t have much time to consider alternate career choices. What are these shards, and why is gathering them so important? There’s a mystery to be solved and multiple worlds to be saved in FLIP FLAPPERS!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Surfing
tags.description: Centers around surfing as a sport.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

name.native: ココナのおばあちゃん

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3227731442)

**Non-anime credits:**
~!- Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth (Video Game, 2018) (OP Director, OP Character Design, OP Storyboard, OP Animation Director, OP Key Animation)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3227731442)

**Non-anime credits:**
~!- Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth (Video Game, 2018) (OP Director, OP Character Design, OP Storyboard, OP Animation Director, OP Key Animation)!~
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/unicococ)

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

ZAQ began to learn the piano at age three. During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer. However, she failed all her auditions. In junior high school, her favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to. Self-taught, her composing and works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/110166086)

Animator turned director originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/110166086)

Animator turned director originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/unicococ)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanu_nisesabori?lang=en)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanu_nisesabori?lang=en)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai) 

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently freelance, with strong ties to [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

While being an accomplished animator on [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Sengoku Basara](https://anilist.co/anime/5355/), he gained notoriety as an Action Animation Director for [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/). Imai, together with Director [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/), CG Director [Shuuhei Yabuta](https://anilist.co/staff/120824/), and fellow animator [Yasuyuki Ebara](https://anilist.co/staff/133640/), conceptualized how Attack on Titan's ODM gear should move in animation, and Imai himself storyboarded and animated many of its action set pieces. 

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mayuge1017)

A Tokyo Zoukei University graduate, he's one of the leading digital animators in the industry, with good character animation and catchy effects.

He is a "follower" of [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/). In his university days, he was in the same circle as [Ryuu Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/133512/). They still have a good relationship and work with each other a lot. 

He is also a good friend of [Takahito Sakazume](https://anilist.co/staff/131945/), the two working often as a "two man production team."

Enokido is mainly known for his work on the Fate franchise, being both the action director for [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/) and having directed the majority of the [Fate/Grand Order Commercials](https://anilist.co/anime/101184/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usagi_rakuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/立川譲)

After graduating from university in 2007, Tachikawa joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he debuted as an episode director on [Kiba](https://anilist.co/anime/845/)'s final episode. After this he went freelance.

Some years later in 2013, Tachikawa created, wrote and directed [Death Billiards](https://anilist.co/anime/14353/), a short film produced by Madhouse as part of Young Animator Training Project's; Anime Mirai, a project which funds young creators and animators. Two years later, Tachikawa got to turn the idea into a 12-episode TV series titled [Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/).

He has since gone on to direct works such as [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/) and [Detective Conan: Zero the Enforcer](https://anilist.co/anime/100653/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aho_boy)

Hiroshi Ikehata is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
